meanings.definition: A needle-like structure in certain organisms.
meanings.sent1: The acicula of the pine tree helps it to retain water.
meanings.sent2: She carefully studied the acicula under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The tiny acicula decided to start a sewing club with the pine needles.
meanings.sent4: Her words were sharp as an acicula, piercing through his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The acicula gleamed in the sunlight, resembling a tiny sword.

meanings.sent1: The acicula of the compass pointed north.
meanings.sent2: He used the acicula of the cactus to carefully pick up the tiny seed.
meanings.sent3: The acicula on the hedgehog's back made it look like a tiny warrior.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze was as sharp as an acicula, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The acicula on the insect's body was so delicate, it seemed almost fragile.
